items.content:
NB: Because this E-learning platform still does not meet all the requirements, some words are not translated in English:

  • aantal vragen = number of questions
  • controleer antwoord = check answer
  • fout = wrong
  • goed = correct
  • introductie = introduction
  • oefening = exercise
  • resultaat = result
  • titel = title
  • vorige = back
  • volgende = next
  • voortgang = progress
  • vraag = question

prompt.body: You are searching for information about (the history of) the European Community. Which search terms provide the most information?

content.body: European Community, European Economic Community, Common Market, European Coal and Steel Community, European Union
Using only the full name, you exclude publications using the abbreviations. Most likely you will miss important information.
European Community, European Economic Community, Common Market, European Coal and Steel Community, European Union, EU, EEC, ECSC
You search by full name and abbreviations. Regardless of the terms used in a publication, full name or abbreviation, the publication is added to the search result.
EU, EEC, ECSC
Using only the abbreviations you'll exclude publications using the full name. Most likely you will miss important information.

prompt.body: You are searching for information about potatoes. Which search terms provide the best information?

content.body: Potato, Potatoes
You are using the single and plural noun. You will find a lot of information, but you forgot the scientific (Latin) term.
Potatoes
You are using only the plural noun. You will miss the information using the single noun or the scientific (Latin) name for potato.
Potato, Potatoes, Solanum tuberosum
By using the single noun and the plural noun you will find a lot of information. By adding the scientific (Latin) term, you will also find scientific articles.

prompt.body: You need information about the behaviour of dogs. Which search terms provide the best information?

content.body: Dog, dogs, canis, behaviour, behavior
Excellent, you are using the single and plural and the Latin noun and you considered the difference between British English and American English.
Dog, dogs, canis, behaviour
Don't forget the American English noun behavior.
Dog, dogs, behaviour, behaviour
You will find a lot of information. By adding the scientific (Latin) term, you will also find scientific articles.

prompt.body: You considered search terms for your subject. For some terms abbreviations may also be used (for example European Union, EU). Which operator would you use to combine the full name and the abbreviation in one search action?

content.body: AND
AND means all the words must be shown. You will miss the publications in which only one of the terms is used.
OR
OR specifies that at least one of the words will turn up in your search result. Use the OR relation when your search result may include synonyms, abbreviations, different spelling variations.
NOT
By using NOT you will exclude a term. That term may not turn up in the results.

prompt.body: You need information about apples. When searching it turns out that a lot of information is about I-pads, I-phones etc. Which operator should you use to exclude the IT-related information?

content.body: AND
AND means all the words must be shown. If you use AND in this case you just will find specific information about the Apple company and products.
OR

OR specifies that at least one of the words will turn up in your search result. Use the OR relation when your search result may include synonyms, abbreviations, different spelling variations. You won't exclude the IT-related information!
NOT
By using NOT you will exclude a term. That term may not turn up in the results. You will exclude the information about the Apple company and products.

prompt.body: You want to use the term United States. Which method should you use to search for this term?

content.body: United States
The search will include both words in random order. This means you will also find information about united farmers in different states of the world.
United AND States
The search will include both words in random order. This means you also find information about united farmers in different states of the world.
"United States"
You receive search results that contain the indicated search terms in this exact order.

prompt.body: You need information and want to use the words demographic, demographical, demography. Where do you put the truncation symbol?

content.body: Demograph*
This is the correct position.
Demo*
This is too early. You will also find words like demolition, demons, demonstration.
Demographi*
This is too late. You will miss the word demography.

prompt.body: You need information about aggression against social workers. Which search string will give the best results?

content.body: "aggression OR violence" and "social workers"

The inverted commas "…" indicate that you want to find search results with the terms in exactly that same order. For social workers that is correct, aggression OR violence you need to type in brackets (…)
Aggression OR (violence AND "social workers")
The brackets (…) are not placed in the correct position. Now you are searching for publications about violence against social workers and about aggression in general.
(aggression OR violence) AND "social workers"
This is correct. You are searching for aggression and/or violence, but only against social workers.

prompt.body: You want information about mountains in Europe. Which search string will give the best results?

content.body: Mountain OR mountains OR hill OR hills AND Europe
You used correct words, but didn't use brackets (…). It's not clear which combinations of words you want to search by.
(mountain* OR hill*) AND Europe
Perfect, you used the brackets (…) and the truncation symbol * correctly.
mountain* OR hill* AND Europe
You used the truncation symbol * correctly, but didn't use the brackets(…). It's not clear which combinations of words you want to search by.

prompt.body: You need geographic information about the two northern regions of Great Britain. Which search string provides the best information?

content.body: ("geographic information" OR GIS) AND ("Northern Ireland" OR Scotland)
You used the brackets (…) and the inverted commas "…" properly.
(geographic information OR GIS) AND (Northern Ireland OR Scotland) (geographic information OR GIS) AND (Northern Ireland OR Scotland)

You didn't use the inverted commas "…" to indicate that the terms need to be used in that exact order. Now you are searching the word geographic and the word information anywhere in the text. The same happens with the term Northern Ireland.
Geographic information OR GIS AND Northern Ireland OR Scotland
You didn't use the brackets (…). It is not clear which combinations of words you want to search by.
